result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Perea was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Pay court costs, all applicable surcharges, assessments and DNA surcharge. To be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in  the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No contact with I.D.L.
No alcohol or illegal drugs.
No use of prescription medications without a valid prescription.

Cooperate with agent.
Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended.
Follow all rules of probation and Extended Supervision.
Pay all supervision fees.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriey. Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, all applicable surcharges, assessments, DNA surcharge during term of Extended Supervision on count one. Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

Report on October 11, 2016 by 5:00 p.m.
Huber release privileges for work.  No electronic monitoring.

Count one.
Count two.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Antonio Perea in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEAR.   Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions for probation and extended supervision:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable. Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation. If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from the defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account; an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with agent
-Cooperate with any correctional programs recommended
-Follow all rules of probation and extended supervision
-Pay all supervision fees 
-Obtain/maintain full-time employment 
-No contact with I.D.L 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or illegal drugs 
-No use of prescription medications without a valid prescription
-Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve 1 YEAR in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work.  No electronic monitoring.   Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on October 11, 2016 by 5:00 p.m.  

-Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments during term of extended supervision on COUNT 1; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge during term of extended supervision on COUNT 1; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Justice Point Violation Report received and filed.  Court will address violation on the next Court date.

Defendant Antonio Perea in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to the amended charges.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.  Court further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.

Defendant Antonio Perea in court with attorney Spiros Stavros Nicolet.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Amended Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Amended Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Court amends charges to COUNT 1:  Substantial Battery, pursuant to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.19(2), a Class I Felony and COUNT 2:  Possession with Intent to Deliver Controlled Substance (THC), pursuant to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 961.41 (1m)(h)2, a Class H Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Antonio Perea in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for status conference.  State reports defense motion filed will likely require a motion hearing.  Defense requests plea and sentencing hearing date. State does not object.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Court ordered that jury trial date remains.  Court addresses the JusticePoint Program report received.  Court notes defendant continues to comply.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services pretrial report received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Motion to Suppress:  Lack of Particularity of Place to be Searched and Item to be Seized received and filed.

Defendant Antonio Perea in court with attorney Paul Ksicinski.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial.  Defense filed a Motion to Suppress.   State will inform Court if motion can be done on the day of trial or if an evidentiary hearing needs to be done.  State does not have to file a response.   Defense motion for modification of Justice Point monitoring heard and denied.  Court sets matter for Status/Final Pretrial.  At the Status date, State to inform the Court of intentions for defense motion.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Antonio Perea in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ksicinski requests an adjournment due to personal issue.  Matter adjourned for plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Report received and filed.

Defendant Antonio Perea in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Thomas Potter for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties continue with settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.   Court grants one last adjournment.   Motion for modification of bail heard and denied.  Bail to remain the same.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Original PRELIMINARY HEARING/BAIL REVIEW Transcript (34 pages) commencing 01/11/2016 received and filed.

Defendant Antonio Perea in court with attorney Paul A. Ksicinski.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Defense needs discovery.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Matter scheduled for a "soft" plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed.
Motion for Permission to File Other Motions Based on Prosecution's Failure to Provide Discovery received and filed.

16RM001832  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
01/12/2016
NOTICE FOR REDUCTION OF BAIL.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Antonio Perea in court with attorney Spiros Stavros Nicolet and Attorney Paul Ksicinski.  Defendant Antonio Perea in custody.  Lovell Johnson for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Kenneth Justus MPD Officer, and Matthew Tracy MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  State Amended Count 1 of the Wis Stats. to 939.05, PTAC on the Original information form.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defense's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Retainer,  received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: I.L. (3/30/1993); R.H. (2/24/1994).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Antonio Perea in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Antonio Perea in custody.  
William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Cimpl, Branch 19.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
